goals.question: What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?
goals.visualization: Box plot of wheat prices by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range, median, and outliers of wheat prices in different regions.

goals.question: What is the trend of wheat production over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of wheat production by year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is an increasing or decreasing trend in wheat production over the years.

goals.question: What is the correlation between wheat production and rainfall?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wheat production vs rainfall
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a positive or negative correlation between wheat production and rainfall.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wheat yield across different regions?
goals.visualization: Box plot of wheat yield by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range, median, and outliers of wheat yield in different regions.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wheat yield and fertilizer usage?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wheat yield vs fertilizer usage
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a positive or negative relationship between wheat yield and fertilizer usage.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Prepare the data
    data['region'] = data['region'].astype('category')
    data['price'] = data['price'].astype(float)

    # Create the box plot
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    data.boxplot(column='price', by='region', ax=ax)

    # Set the title and labels
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?')
    ax.set_xlabel('Region')
    ax.set_ylabel('Wheat Prices')
    plt.suptitle('')

    # Rotate x-axis labels
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['year'])]
    data['year'] = data['year'].dt.year

    plt.plot(data['year'], data['wheat_production'], label='Wheat Production')
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Wheat Production')
    plt.title('What is the trend of wheat production over the years?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['rainfall'], data['wheat_production'])
    plt.xlabel('Rainfall')
    plt.ylabel('Wheat Production')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between wheat production and rainfall?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    data.boxplot(column='wheat_yield', by='region', ax=ax)
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of wheat yield across different regions?')
    ax.set_xlabel('Region')
    ax.set_ylabel('Wheat Yield')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.suptitle('')
    plt.legend(title='Region', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['fertilizer_usage'], data['wheat_yield'])
    plt.xlabel('Fertilizer Usage')
    plt.ylabel('Wheat Yield')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wheat yield and fertilizer usage?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
